verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities.
verses.ct: After Jesus finished giving instructions to his 12 disciples, he left that area to teach and preach in the surrounding towns.

verses.kjv: Now when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples,
verses.ct: While John was in prison, he heard about what Christ was doing and sent 2 of his disciples to him.

verses.kjv: And said unto him, Art thou he that should come, or do we look for another?
verses.ct: They asked him, "Are you the one who was promised to come, or should we be waiting for someone else?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said unto them, Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see:
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Go back and report to John what you're hearing and seeing:

verses.kjv: The blind receive their sight, and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have the gospel preached to them.
verses.ct: Blind people are gaining their sight, those who couldn't walk are walking, people with leprosy are being healed, deaf people are hearing, dead people are being brought back to life, and the good news is being shared with the poor.

verses.kjv: And blessed is he, whosoever shall not be offended in me.
verses.ct: How fortunate is the person who doesn't lose faith because of me."

verses.kjv: And as they departed, Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken with the wind?
verses.ct: As John's disciples were leaving, Jesus started speaking to the crowds about John: "What did you go out into the wilderness to look at? A stalk of grass swaying in the wind?

verses.kjv: But what went ye out for to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? behold, they that wear soft clothing are in kings’ houses.
verses.ct: Then what did you go out to see? A man dressed in expensive clothing? Look, people who wear fine clothes live in royal palaces.

verses.kjv: But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? yea, I say unto you, and more than a prophet.
verses.ct: So what did you really go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I'm telling you — and far more than a prophet.

verses.kjv: For this is he, of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.
verses.ct: This is the one the Scriptures are talking about when they say, 'Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your path before you.'

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, Among them that are born of women there hath not risen a greater than John the Baptist: notwithstanding he that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
verses.ct: Truly I tell you, no one ever born has been greater than John the Baptist. And yet even the least important person in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he is.

verses.kjv: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffereth violence, and the violent take it by force.
verses.ct: From the time of John the Baptist until now, the kingdom of heaven has been under violent assault, and aggressive people are trying to seize it by force.

verses.kjv: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.
verses.ct: All the Prophets and the Law pointed forward to what was coming, right up until John.

verses.kjv: And if ye will receive it, this is Elias, which was for to come.
verses.ct: If you're willing to accept it, he is the Elijah who was expected to come.

verses.kjv: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.ct: Whoever has ears to hear should pay attention.

verses.kjv: But whereunto shall I liken this generation? It is like unto children sitting in the markets, and calling unto their fellows,
verses.ct: What can I compare this generation to? They're like children sitting in the marketplace calling out to each other,

verses.kjv: And saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned unto you, and ye have not lamented.
verses.ct: 'We played music for you, but you wouldn't dance; we sang sad songs for you, but you wouldn't mourn.'

verses.kjv: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He hath a devil.
verses.ct: John came fasting and not drinking, and people say, 'He has a demon.'

verses.kjv: The Son of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Behold a man gluttonous, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners. But wisdom is justified of her children.
verses.ct: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and people say, 'Look at this glutton and drunkard — a friend of tax collectors and sinners!' But wisdom is proven right by what it produces."

verses.kjv: Then began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done, because they repented not:
verses.ct: Then Jesus began to criticize the towns where he had performed most of his miracles, because they refused to turn from their sins:

verses.kjv: Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works, which were done in you, had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.ct: "How terrible it will be for you, Chorazin! How terrible for you, Bethsaida! If the miracles performed in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, those cities would have turned from their sins long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

verses.kjv: But I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment, than for you.
verses.ct: I'm telling you, Tyre and Sidon will be better off on judgment day than you will.

verses.kjv: And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted unto heaven, shalt be brought down to hell: for if the mighty works, which have been done in thee, had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.
verses.ct: And you, Capernaum — will you be lifted up to heaven? No, you will be thrown down to hell. If the miracles done in you had been performed in Sodom, it would still be standing today.

verses.kjv: But I say unto you, That it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment, than for thee.
verses.ct: I'm telling you, the land of Sodom will be better off on judgment day than you will."

verses.kjv: At that time Jesus answered and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes.
verses.ct: At that time Jesus said, "I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and educated, and revealed them to those who are like little children.

verses.kjv: Even so, Father: for so it seemed good in thy sight.
verses.ct: Yes, Father, because this is exactly what pleased you.

verses.kjv: All things are delivered unto me of my Father: and no man knoweth the Son, but the Father; neither knoweth any man the Father, save the Son, and he to whomsoever the Son will reveal him.
verses.ct: My Father has entrusted everything to me. No one truly knows the Son except the Father, and no one truly knows the Father except the Son and anyone the Son chooses to reveal him to.

verses.kjv: Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
verses.ct: Come to me, all of you who are exhausted and weighed down with heavy burdens, and I will give you rest.

verses.kjv: Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.
verses.ct: Accept my yoke and learn from me, because I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.

verses.kjv: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.
verses.ct: Because my yoke is not difficult, and my burden is light."
